etymology.description: Depicts two entangled ropes -> to entangle; intertwine -> original form of 糾(糾) (jiū, "to correct")
etymology.interpretation: The character 丩(丩) (jiū, "twist") visually represents two ropes twisted together, symbolizing the concept of intertwining or entanglement. It served as the original form of 糾(糾), which later developed a different sense.
